required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Korean Medicine Registry for Low Back Pain-prospective Observational Multicenter Study (KLOS)
clinical_study.official_title: Korean Medicine Registry for Low Back Pain-prospective Observational Multicenter Study (KLOS)

lead_sponsor.agency: Gachon University Gil Oriental Medical Hospital

collaborator.agency: Sangji University Oriental Medical Center, Korea
Semyung University Korean Medicine Hospital in Chungju, Korea
Kyunghee University Oriental Medical Center, Korea
Useok University Oriental Medical Center, Korea
Dunsan Korean Medicine Hospital of Daejeon University,Korea
Pusan National University Korean Medicine Hospital, Korea

clinical_study.source: Gachon University Gil Oriental Medical Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The Purpose of this trial is to define the characteristics of the patients with low back pain in oriental rehabilitation clinic. This information will create a registry that will help us to compare similarities and differences in patients and their symptoms. The more patients the investigators are able to enter into the registry, the more the investigators will be able to understand the low back pain and learn better ways of caring for patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in 'Roland Morris Disability Questionnaire'
primary_outcome.time_frame: at Baseline, Second Visit(Scheduled within a month of baseline), 4 Weeks and 12 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: This is a self-reported questionnaire consisting of 24 items reflecting limitations in different activities of daily living attributed to low back pain including walking, bending over, sitting, lying down, dressing, sleeping, self-care and daily activities.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Pattern Identification Questionnaire of Low Back Pain
Change from Baseline in Questionnaire for Characteristics of Low Back Pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at Baseline, Second Visit(Scheduled within a month of baseline), 4 Weeks and 12 Weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Neurological Examination for Low Back Pain
Change from Baseline in Numeric Rating Scale of Pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at Baseline, Second Visit(Scheduled within a month of baseline), 4 Weeks and 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: A 10-point Numerical Pain Rating Scale (NPRS; 0: no pain, 10: maximum pain) assesses the patients' current level of pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in European Quality of life 5 Dimension
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D is an international, standardized, generic instrument for describing and valuing health status. Participants were asked to indicate which of the following statements best describes their health state.

arm_group.description: Patients with low back pain in oriental rehabilitation clinic

intervention.description: There are no interventions associated with this registry as it is purely observational.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with low back pain who are visiting oriental rehabiliation clinic

overall_official.affiliation: Gachon University, Gil Oriental Medical Center

facility.name: Gachon University, Gil Oriental Medicine Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Gachon University Gil Oriental Medical Hospital
